summary: This document consists of internal email correspondence from July 23, 2019, regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status on suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It reports that Epstein complained of a swollen throat, requested to call his attorney, and alleged that his cellmate tried to kill him in the early morning hours.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at the center of the communications, identified by inmate number #76318-054, who is on suicide watch and reports health issues and an alleged assault.

persons.name: Inmate Companion
persons.context: An unidentified staff member (likely a correctional officer or assigned observer) on suicide watch duty who relays Epstein's complaints and requests to other personnel via phone calls.

connections.description: The Inmate Companion is monitoring Epstein on suicide watch and serves as the communication channel for his reported medical issue and request to contact his attorney.

events.title: Epstein reports swollen throat and requests attorney
events.description: Through the Inmate Companion, inmate Jeffrey Epstein reports that his throat is swollen and expresses a desire to call his attorney.

events.title: Epstein alleges cellmate attempted murder
events.description: According to a Suicide Watch Log entry from about 2:15 AM, inmate Epstein told staff watching him that his cellmate tried to kill him.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (inferred from context and inmate number format)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on formal suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 23, 2019.
Epstein reported a medical issue (swollen throat) and requested to contact his attorney on that date.
Epstein alleged, according to a log entry from early that morning, that his cellmate had tried to kill him.
The communications are internal, time-stamped emails marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' from the SDNY (Southern District of New York).
These events occurred approximately two weeks before Epstein's death by suicide on August 10, 2019.
